content: Eritrea has previously denied accusations that its soldiers are in Ethiopia supporting rebels.

title: Man named in South Africa's police corruption probe found dead
content: Reports say Wiandre Pretorius, who last week said he survived an assassination attempt, shot himself.

title: A singer's tragic death highlights Nigeria's snakebite problem
content: The crisis is compounded by a critical shortage of affordable, properly stored antivenom.

title: Trump hosts Honduras’s new president Asfura at Mar-a-Lago in US
content: The US president praises his newly inaugurated 'friend' and hails strong US-Honduras security ties.

content: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud on Israel’s Somaliland move, US pressure, security fears and Somalia’s political future.

title: Understanding the value of gold: Prices, global reserves, and market trends
content: Gold prices have quadrupled in one decade, attracting investors amid economic uncertainty and geopolitical tensions.

originalTitle: Japan's governing party projected to win snap election majority
title: Japan's governing party projected to win snap election majority
content: A coalition led by current Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is expected to clinch a decisive win, according to media projections after polls closed.

title: Polls close in Thai election pitting reformists against conservatives
content: Thai voters are choosing between sweeping change or more of the same in an election called after several coalition governments collapsed.

title: Russia names three suspects over shooting of general

title: The new top-flight Canadian club inspired by Athletic Bilbao
content: Supra du Quebec kick off their inaugural Canadian Premier League in April and will field only players born or raised in the province.

title: How did Arsenal 'unlock' Sunderland's defence?
content: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer explains how a "piece of brilliance" combined with effective substitutions allowed Arsenal to break down Sunderland's defence, in their 3-0 home win in the Premier League.
